blog.name: rubbady-pubbady
blog.title: Too Much Time On My Hands

summary: I'm really hoping someone, at some point, (preferably Jon) says that SANSA WAS RIGHT ALL ALONG!
body: I’m really hoping someone, at some point, (preferably Jon) says that SANSA WAS RIGHT ALL ALONG!

blog.name: hopelesstvaddict
blog.title: worry about the past. the future can wait.
blog.description:
No need to know the nAme. 
Swoon and marvel at simple things.
LOST defined life. Live in the Enchanted Forest. Love what happens in Westeros. Wish you could hang out in Rosewood with some pretty little liars. Agonize over the events in Beacon Hills. And so on. Unconditional Cut & Run, Titanic and LOTR lover. 
Proud Princess Aurora, Sansa Stark and Alison Dilaurentis supporter.

body:
GOT 8x05 Quick disorganized thoughts

  • Overall I liked the episode. There. We’ve made that clear
  • No time jumping. No fast travel. Always a good point
  • Dark Dany. Yes. Yes. Yes. And no it wasn’t OOC or too sudden. It’s been there for seasons now.
  • All the action is concentrated in the South. Meaning no Winterfell and I kept wondering when were we gonna switch to the North. But smart choice
  • Miguel Sapochnik’s direction is really the best. But I still place this one behind The Long Night and I maintain that Battle of the Bastards is still the best GOT episode. Ever
  • All episode long I kept thinking ‘man Sansa would SO not approve any of this shit’
  • 'Sandor’. That’s it
  • Seriously I also disagree that Arya’s character development was thrown away. That was always the point. To let her grow from all this rage and sense of vengeance that’s been eating her alive since forever and let her become human again. Have her gain back a sense of humanity. That was what Maisie said her arc would be, finding that balance between Arya the girl she was and Arya the killing machine she has become
  • Cleganebowl. Of course they’d save it until the end. And no I didn’t find it anticlimactic. As much as I wanted Sandor to win, his brother is a fucking zombie. He cannot be killed like that. Sandor had an amazing character arc and his redemption climaxed here through his relationship with Arya. The last thing he needed to resolve was his brother and ultimately they were too linked to each other to survive. Neither could win properly and Sandor was not a good man either. A happy ending was never in the cards for him
  • The same applies for Jaime and Cersei. Call me crazy but I actually liked their ending. A bit melodramatic maybe ? But the whole episode portrays Cersei in a rather sympathetic way, far from the ruthless persona we’ve seen before. This is partly to really portray Dany as the villain here. And the reasoning works here too. Jaime might be a redeemed man but he is not a good man. Neither is Cersei. There was no happy ending for them either
  • Though I thought that Jaime would kill Cersei I’m glad that this is not what happened. Jaime and Cersei started the series and their lives together. It makes sense they would end it in a similar way. We knew that Cersei would die this episode. We didn’t expect Jaime to be there with her nor the manner of death. But believe me or not I’m actually satisfied. Having Dany kill Cersei would probably have been too much
  • Jaime recognizes that his relationship with Cersei is toxic and yet they’re irredeemably intertwined and I was sold. By Lena and Nikolaj’s acting solely
  • Dany finally alienates herself from Jon. Jon finally understands what his Queen is. Better late than never
  • Varys is betrayed by Tyrion. I didn’t understand why… is Tyrion really this loyal to Dany ? Did he purposely blind himself until he couldn’t anymore ? Jon is creeped out by the burning alive. He just couldn’t do anything about it because he’s afraid of Dany. The difference with Mance in S5 is he did something then because he wasn’t afraid to stand up to Stannis
  • Lol how could so many Dothraki survive the charge against the wights ?
  • Greyworm loses it and he’s seemingly gonna go up against Jon. But I understood where he came from. Missandei’s passing was handled properly, both from Greyworm and Dany’s side
  • Jon will have to rise up against Dany. He has no choice. Here for it but I really hope they don’t pull the tragic love story card. Please confirm that Jon was not a stupid lovesick fool
  • Where will Arya go ? To find Jon ? Back North ?
  • Seriously it’s been two major battles and we were robbed of Jon and Arya fighting alongside each other. I’d have loved to see Jon being smacked at how good his baby sister has become
  • Jon saving the girl from rape indeed reminded me of Sansa’s near rape scene. In fact that’s not the only time I was reminded of Sansa. When Arya passes civilians there are many shots of girls in lady dresses and frightened non-fighters who reminded me of Sansa - who stands for this specific group of people. Maybe that was just me
  • Euron. Glad the fucker is done with. Kind of weirded out that Dany is able to take on his entire fleet and the whole of the ballistas this time around yet she was so ineffective in the last episode but ok. I was so happy Jaime killed him though I also wish Dany burned him
  • No Sansa vs Cersei showdown I guess. A tad disappointed
  • What happened with the scene where Jon kneels to Cersei ? So that wasn’t a scene at all ?
  • Remembering that Sophie was incredibly satisfied with her ending. That she kept a spoilery scroll as a souvenir and that she was gifted the storyboard for her final scene. Excited to see what this is. Apparently Sophie filmed in Spain but perhaps she won’t go south at all ?
  • Dany will want to deal with her though. And with Jon. She will come for the Starks. She wants to instigate fear but she knows Sansa is not afraid. Jon is or was up until this episode
  • The promo for the series finale focuses on Arya, Tyrion and Dany. Sansa isn’t shown meaning they don’t want to reveal anything on her scenes yet. And what they don’t show us is usually the meaty part of the episodes
  • That’s it. More complete recap to come later
  • Oh and Ramin Djawadi really took a vacation between Ep3 and Ep5 because he’s back at doing actual great music again

The last thing he needed to resolve was his brother and ultimately they were too linked to each other to survive. Neither could win properly and Sandor was not a good man either. A happy ending was never in the cards for him
  • The same applies for Jaime and Cersei. Call me crazy but I actually liked their ending. A bit melodramatic maybe ? But the whole episode portrays Cersei in a rather sympathetic way, far from the ruthless persona we’ve seen before. This is partly to really portray Dany as the villain here. And the reasoning works here too. Jaime might be a redeemed man but he is not a good man. Neither is Cersei. There was no happy ending for them either
  • Though I thought that Jaime would kill Cersei I’m glad that this is not what happened. Jaime and Cersei started the series and their lives together. It makes sense they would end it in a similar way. We knew that Cersei would die this episode. We didn’t expect Jaime to be there with her nor the manner of death. But believe me or not I’m actually satisfied. Having Dany kill Cersei would probably have been too much
  • Jaime recognizes that his relationship with Cersei is toxic and yet they’re irredeemably intertwined and I was sold. By Lena and Nikolaj’s acting solely
  • Dany finally alienates herself from Jon. Jon finally understands what his Queen is. Better late than never
  • Varys is betrayed by Tyrion. I didn’t understand why… is Tyrion really this loyal to Dany ? Did he purposely blind himself until he couldn’t anymore ? Jon is creeped out by the burning alive. He just couldn’t do anything about it because he’s afraid of Dany. The difference with Mance in S5 is he did something then because he wasn’t afraid to stand up to Stannis
  • Lol how could so many Dothraki survive the charge against the wights ?
  • Greyworm loses it and he’s seemingly gonna go up against Jon. But I understood where he came from. Missandei’s passing was handled properly, both from Greyworm and Dany’s side
  • Jon will have to rise up against Dany. He has no choice. Here for it but I really hope they don’t pull the tragic love story card. Please confirm that Jon was not a stupid lovesick fool
  • Where will Arya go ? To find Jon ? Back North ?
  • Seriously it’s been two major battles and we were robbed of Jon and Arya fighting alongside each other. I’d have loved to see Jon being smacked at how good his baby sister has become
  • Jon saving the girl from rape indeed reminded me of Sansa’s near rape scene. In fact that’s not the only time I was reminded of Sansa. When Arya passes civilians there are many shots of girls in lady dresses and frightened non-fighters who reminded me of Sansa - who stands for this specific group of people. Maybe that was just me
  • Euron. Glad the fucker is done with. Kind of weirded out that Dany is able to take on his entire fleet and the whole of the ballistas this time around yet she was so ineffective in the last episode but ok. I was so happy Jaime killed him though I also wish Dany burned him
  • No Sansa vs Cersei showdown I guess. A tad disappointed
  • What happened with the scene where Jon kneels to Cersei ? So that wasn’t a scene at all ?
  • Remembering that Sophie was incredibly satisfied with her ending. That she kept a spoilery scroll as a souvenir and that she was gifted the storyboard for her final scene. Excited to see what this is. Apparently Sophie filmed in Spain but perhaps she won’t go south at all ?
  • Dany will want to deal with her though. And with Jon. She will come for the Starks. She wants to instigate fear but she knows Sansa is not afraid. Jon is or was up until this episode
  • The promo for the series finale focuses on Arya, Tyrion and Dany. Sansa isn’t shown meaning they don’t want to reveal anything on her scenes yet. And what they don’t show us is usually the meaty part of the episodes
  • That’s it. More complete recap to come later
  • Oh and Ramin Djawadi really took a vacation between Ep3 and Ep5 because he’s back at doing actual great music again

summary: Who is going to sit on the Iron Throne?

reblog.comment: • Who is going to sit on the Iron Throne?

trail.content_raw: • Who is going to sit on the Iron Throne?
trail.content: • Who is going to sit on the Iron Throne?

summary:
What happened to Robbin, what happened to Edmure? What about house Glover?
If Jon kills Daenerys I don't think the unsullied or...
body:
What happened to Robbin, what happened to Edmure? What about house Glover?

If Jon kills Daenerys I don’t think the unsullied or the dorthtraki are going to let him get away with it.

My theory is Sansa shows up with what’s left of the armies from the north, Riverlands, the vale, and they help defeat what’s left of Daenerys army.

In the for the throne trailer they have the clip of Sansa showing up with the vale. I don’t think they used those scenes just to show what happened in previous episodes. Rather, they used it as foreshadowing of what’s to come this season.

In the for the throne trailer they have the clip of Sansa showing up with the vale. I don’t think they used those scenes just to show what happened in previous episodes. Rather, they used it as foreshadowing of what’s to come this season.

blog.name: bethandsansa
blog.title: Beth&Sansa
blog.description:
I will never be over how GoT S8 did us wrong.

Currently obsessed with Max Minghella's eyebrows. I also cry about BTS a lot.

summary: I really hope D&D doesn’t take all this negative response to this season as some sort of compliment on how they subverted...
body: I really hope D&D doesn’t take all this negative response to this season as some sort of compliment on how they subverted expectations. We hate this season because it exposes how audaciously lazy and appallingly incompetent you are as writers.

reblog.comment: I really hope D&D doesn’t take all this negative response to this season as some sort of compliment on how they subverted expectations. We hate this season because it exposes how audaciously lazy and appallingly incompetent you are as writers.

trail.content_raw: I really hope D&D doesn’t take all this negative response to this season as some sort of compliment on how they subverted expectations. We hate this season because it exposes how audaciously lazy and appallingly incompetent you are as writers.

tags: the i smell like beef one was dark ik sorry guys
summary:
Vines that Sum up GoT S8 Ep5
Everyone @ Dany: ah fuck...I can't believe you've done this
Grey Worm: *enemy comes at him* I won't...
body:
Vines that Sum up GoT S8 Ep5

Everyone @ Dany: ah fuck…I can’t believe you’ve done this

Grey Worm: *enemy comes at him* I won’t hesitate BITCH

Innocent civillian: *on fire* I SMELL LIKE BEEEEEFF

Tyrion after Dany ignored him: what the fuck richard

Arya @ woman: Miss Keisha? Miss Keisha? Oh my god, she fuckin’ dead

Dany: We all die you either kill yourself or get killed

Bonus

Sansa @ jon next ep: THIS IS WHY MOM DOESN’T FUCKING LOVE YOU

blog.name: thefandommama

summary: In Jon's case, he never really dealt with a true psychopath on Daenerys' level. With Ygritte, he seemed to reason away her...
question: In Jon's case, he never really dealt with a true psychopath on Daenerys' level. With Ygritte, he seemed to reason away her brutality to her being a Wildling and having her heart broke by him. He was afraid of both women, but he still didn't understand how far they'd go. But Sansa had to deal with the likes of Cersei, Joffrey, LF,  and Ramsay since she was a young girl. She knew that monsters like them are never satisfied. She saw the same kind of greed and callousness in the Dragon Queen.
answer:
Certainly not on Daenerys level, no. I’m sure Jon could chalk Ygritte’s behavior to as you said, being a Wildling. Even if he grew to respect the Free Folk they were undeniably brutal people and their environment helped Jon still loving Ygritte despite that darker side. She also wasn’t a complete monster as we see, she keeps Gilly and Little Sam safe when she could have easily killed them both. Daenerys…well…that wasn’t the case. And it’s on such a larger scale with Daenerys. This was a whole capital she just burned to the ground.

Jon’s dealt with some tough sons of bitches who were crazy but not like Daenerys. He came to fighting alongside the Free Folk because he understood where they were coming from. But this was mass slaughter and such senseless cruelty.

He may have been scared and most likely always was, but he probably never thought she’d go through with it till it was too late. Sansa on the other hand has dealt with people who don’t show their cards right away. Lysa, Cersei, Ramsay, Joffery, Littlefinger. All she had to read to same way she read through Daenerys the moment that letter came from Dragonstone and Jon couldn’t because his enemies have always been a bit more black and white. Now he knows. But now it’s too late.

summary: So the latest episode was obviously a way for the writers to get Jon on the throne without dealing with the fact that they just...
body:
So the latest episode was obviously a way for the writers to get Jon on the throne without dealing with the fact that they just wanted their fav (who has a dick, so weird, I’m sure that has no relevance) BUT

I loved the scene with Arya finding the white horse and riding out of King’s Landing so could people link me to all the gif sets of that?

SHE RIDES UPON A PALE HORSE, BITCH.

Also let’s hope that Gendry hasn’t left Winterfall yet so Arya can get some sisterly comfort after this episode and THEN some more quality dick.

summary: My wish for the ending of s8
body:
My wish for the ending of s8

Is that Bran, Arya and Sansa just get to eat chocolate (or lemon cakes) in a great big room, where the world is a different place.

summary: Is it weird that I feel kind of bad that literally EVERYONE on this show has had at least one hot sex/nude scene, except for...
question: Is it weird that I feel kind of bad that literally EVERYONE on this show has had at least one hot sex/nude scene, except for Sansa. All she gets is a disgusting rape in season 5. Sophie Turner has yet to have a good consensual love scene on this show and I strangely feel.... sad about that.
answer:
It’s not weird at all! I feel the same way.

Arya’s first time was with Gendry a man she once loved and it was consenting and sweet. Brienne’s first time was with Jaime, a man she loved and chose. Missandei and Greyworm got a 2+ minute sex scene consummating their love and overcoming their pains and past.

Sansa’s entire storyline has been wrapped around marriage, love, sex and children. Sophie confirmed that’s what Sansa used to dream about growing up and all of her encounters thus far have been horrifying for her. No matter who it’s with, I want there to be someone in Sansa’s life that can show her respect and love her for her and not her claim. To show her there isn’t just monsters in the world and she could have what her parents had. She deserves it and I want to see Sansa having all the loving and consenting scenes. Just ONE!

blog.name: hermajestyqueensansa
blog.title: hermajestyqueensansa
blog.description:
prev. jonsanity. sansa stark stan. anti show!jon snow jonsa. idk I'm a confused bitch. header by @ragekitn.
icon by @itwasmycroftbbc.

summary: I really don’t know what to believe anymore, do you still have hope on Jonsa? Like I’m afraid that she isn’t gonna have so much...
question: I really don’t know what to believe anymore, do you still have hope on Jonsa? Like I’m afraid that she isn’t gonna have so much screen time, like just to put a crow on her
answer:
I feel just as confused as you…

but… l started this show as a sansa stark stan, became a jonsa in season 6, and came to love jon snow through that. If political jon isn’t true jon can choke, but as of now I truly believe it is. It was just written poorly and I believe political!Jon “I fucked up” snow is still in the cards for the last episode. I also believe sansa won’t let jon live in absolute misery and self-loathing and she is going to bring him back, like she did once before and previously with theon.

So if political jon isn’t true or romantic jonsa isn’t canon, I’m going to have peace knowing I stanned the true queen from day 1. I believe sansa will win the game of thrones, and I believe political jon is still a strong possibility because of her and jon’s need to protect her, and I think her love for jon will rescue Jon’s character.

So believe in Sansa Stark!

To Sansa Stark!

summary: If the leaks are true. And Jonsa is not a thing, then no man ever really loved Sansa.
title: If the leaks are true. And Jonsa is not a thing, then no man ever really loved Sansa.
body:
Even LF only loved her (I believe he was mostly lusting like Tyrion), that’s only only because she’s similar to her mother.

While Daenerys, was loved by countless men.

Miserable girl.
